metadata.synopsis: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.

1.speaker: Torturer Spike
1.text: No! I wanted him to suffer! N-not that you killed him too easily, your drowness. I meant no offence.
1.context: NodeContext: He says the 'no! I wanted him to suffer!' on instinct, then realises he's talking to a drow and scrambles to correct himself and show enough reverence.

2.speaker: Torturer Spike
2.text: He can't be dead! I never got any answers out of him!
2.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblins don't know where the den is.NodeContext: Spike is extremely worried. The palyer killed the prisoner he had to extract information from, and he's certain his commander will kill him for his failure.

0.speaker: Torturer Spike
0.text: She'll kill me. This is it. This is the end... but oh, I'll make you pay before I die.
0.context: NodeContext: Fiercely angry - about to attack the player.

3.speaker: Torturer Spike
3.text: No! I still had more to do with him! Guess I'll have to give his due to you, eh?
3.context: NodeContext: sadistic - he couldn't exact revenge on the prisoner, so the player will have to pay instead. Starts combat.
